summary: This is a protective order issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). The order establishes strict rules governing the handling, use, and disclosure of sensitive discovery materials produced by the government, including confidential witness/victim information and highly confidential sexualized images.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for whom this protective order is issued, governing the handling of discovery materials.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued this protective order in the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell and issued this protective order.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues a protective order in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, establishing rules for handling sensitive discovery materials.

keyFacts: The protective order governs discovery materials that include sensitive, confidential, or personal identifying information, as well as nude, partially-nude, or otherwise sexualized images/videos (designated 'Highly Confidential Information').

The order strictly limits who can access the materials (defendant, defense counsel, designated experts/staff, potential witnesses) and prohibits public disclosure of victim/witness identities from the discovery.
The defendant (Maxwell) is only allowed to review hard copy discovery in the presence of her defense counsel and electronic discovery through Bureau of Prisons systems.
The order indicates the government's investigation is ongoing and aims to prevent prejudicial pretrial publicity and protect victim/witness privacy.
